intro: Quivisia decandra, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange and bloom in clusters. Quivisia decandra is often found in moist, shaded environments and can be invasive in certain regions.
